Parameters: SeekBar.OnSeekBarChangeListener: The seek bar notification listener
setOnSeekBarChangeListener(android.widge.Description: Sets a listener to receive notifications of changes to the SeekBar's progress level. Also provides notifications of when the user starts and stops a touch gesture within the SeekBar.

SeekBar(android.content.Context,android..FullName: public SeekBar (Context context, AttributeSet attrs, int defStyleAttr, int defStyleRes)

getAccessibilityClassName().Description: Return the class name of this object to be used for accessibility purposes. Subclasses should only override this if they are implementing something that should be seen as a completely new class of view when used by accessibility, unrelated to the class it is deriving from. This is used to fill in @B_android#view#accessibility#AccessibilityNodeInfo#setClassName_E@.

SeekBar(android.content.Context,android..FullName: public SeekBar (Context context, AttributeSet attrs, int defStyleAttr)

ClassDesc: A SeekBar is an extension of ProgressBar that adds a draggable thumb. The user can touch the thumb and drag left or right to set the current progress level or use the arrow keys. Placing focusable widgets to the left or right of a SeekBar is discouraged. Clients of the SeekBar can attach a @B_android#widget#SeekBar#OnSeekBarChangeListener_E@ to be notified of the user's actions.
